data.title: Blackout-Bingo
data.statement:
To win a game of "Blackout-Bingo", you have to cover all 24 numbers (and the free space) on your Card.

Input is a Bingo-Card, followed by the [[ballsDrawn]] from the tumbler, up until the present moment.


Your task is:
Determine the <<minimum>> number of more balls [[minNumOfMoreBalls]] needed for your Card to have <<any>> possibility of a win
data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[minNumOfMoreBalls]] ≤ 24
Line 1 of input is not needed to solve this puzzle; it’s provided only for aesthetic purposes
data.stubGenerator:
read BingoHeader:string(20)
loop 5 read ROW:string(20)
read BallsDrawn:string(300)
write minimum_Additional_Balls_Needed_for_Possible_BlackOut_Bingo
data.inputDescription:
<<Lines 1:>> A string, the "B I N G O" header on the Bingo-Card
<<Next 5 Lines:>> Strings, a Bingo-Card, including the {{FR}} (free) spot in the center
<<Next Line:>> [[ballsDrawn]] separated by spaces, in the format that includes their letter, such as B7 and N42

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

To win a game of "Blackout-Bingo", you have to cover all 24 numbers (and the free space) on your Card.

Input is a Bingo-Card, followed by the ballsDrawn from the tumbler, up until the present moment.


Your task is:
Determine the minimum number of more balls minNumOfMoreBalls needed for your Card to have any possibility of a win
Input
Lines 1: A string, the "B I N G O" header on the Bingo-Card
Next 5 Lines: Strings, a Bingo-Card, including the FR (free) spot in the center
Next Line: ballsDrawn separated by spaces, in the format that includes their letter, such as B7 and N42
Output
Line1: An integer minNumOfMoreBalls
Constraints
0 ≤ minNumOfMoreBalls ≤ 24
Line 1 of input is not needed to solve this puzzle; it’s provided only for aesthetic purposes
Example
Input
 B   I   N   G   O
12  18  33  57  61
 9  24  45  58  66
 8  26  FR  59  65
10  25  44  46  75
 2  23  36  56  63
N44 I23 I25 B2 O69 O73
Output
20
